abstract: Hurt by declining sales of some of its biggest drugs and vaccines, Merck said that it would cut another 7,200 jobs, or 12 percent of its work force, in its second revamping in three years.
snippet: Hurt by declining sales of some of its biggest drugs and vaccines, Merck said that it would cut another 7,200 jobs, or 12 percent of its work force, in its second revamping in three years.
lead_paragraph: Merck, hurt by declining sales of some of its biggest drugs and vaccines, said on Wednesday that it would cut 7,200 more jobs, or more than 12 percent of its work force, its second revamping in three years.

headline.main: Merck Plans to Cut 12% of Work Force as Its Sales and Profit Fall
headline.print_headline: Merck Plans to Cut 12% of Work Force as Its Sales and Profit Fall
